website_summaries.verdict: A convection microwave with plenty of convenient settings that has the capacity to cook a good amount of food.
pros: Offers 9 presets, including popcorn, potato, roast chicken, cake, and pizza
Cooking settings include microwave, convection, convection roast, convection fast bake, grill, keep warm, defrost, and memory
cons: The outside does heat up significantly when using the convection setting

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on June 9, 2016, microwave worked fine, on august 3 wife tried to use convection oven it made terrible sound like something coming apart. Amazon has a 30 return policy so I had to call Cuisinart. I had to pay $55.00 shipping and had to include $15.00 to have unit shipped back to me when repaired. I had a Sharps that lasted 25 years with no trouble, this thing didn't last 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: gwenma

customer_reviews.title: 1 STAR... 2 MANY... 0 STARS... SPOT ON!...
customer_reviews.text: Do not be fooled by the name... Cusinart... or the 4 star review average... this Cuisnart CMW 100 microwave is a piece of junk... it takes 22 minutes to microwave a 16 ounce bag of brussel sprots... 22 feaking minutes... As for the 4 star average... the reviews for the 2 models... CMW 100 AND CMW 200 Confection/Microwave are mixed together... just check the 1 Star reviews... Forewarned is Forearmed...
customer_reviews.author: PM74

customer_reviews.title: Can’t handle high power cooking for more than 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: After having this for few months with reheat left over, and I’m trying to cook a chicken, while cooking for 10 minutes, the microwave shut down, no light because too hot, have to leave it cool down approx 6-8 minute and light come back and on. The microwave cannot handle high power for more than 10 minutes
customer_reviews.author: Larry Chung

customer_reviews.title: WASTEof $ & Time
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest made appliance with the worst customer service from both the vendor and the manufacturer. The unit is not stainless steel. The door sides are PLASTIC and break easily. The heating for both convection and microwave is terrible. The vendor refuses to do anything as well as amazon or Cuisinart. I do not recommend Cuisinart for any product as the customer service and 3 year limited warranty mean nothing.
customer_reviews.author: rhonda sanders

customer_reviews.title: Terribly underpowered - don't buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Terribly underpowered!! If I could give this microwave less than one star I would. I bought this because it was microwave and convection. At first I thought it was a compromise on microwave power to less than what I was used to because it had the convection feature but this oven does neither well. You might was well turn on your wall oven and just cook everything there.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi B Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Low quality and terrible warranty
customer_reviews.text: The oven's features and 3-year warranty are attractive to me. But the quality of product and its warranty service are terrible. The oven's mechanical parts are made of weak plastic and are easily broken. In my case, the thin post holding door button is broken (see the picture) and I could not open the door anymore. To repair, the customers have to ship the big and heavy microwave back to the company at their own cost. It is not cheap and the process is also very slow. The worst thing is Cuisinart even refused to sell the parts to me. Very Bad experience!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Z

customer_reviews.title: NOT happy !
customer_reviews.text: My oven does NOT brown. It does NOT cook thoroughly. The upper (grill) element does NOT glow. Contacted Cuisinart; they offered to repair unit only --- would NOT talk about replacement in any way, shape, or form. This is my only baking and my only microwave unit. Have had it only 5 weeks. Any suggestions? One star only for the microwave functions. Later-same day; Amazon refunded purchase price, saying my problems are Very Frequent with this unit. Available now only thru 3rd party sellers......be very aware of problems with this one..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not like my Oster
customer_reviews.text: I had a prior Oster convection microwave oven which died after 8 faithful years. I love this Cuisinart convection microwave oven. It has more setting options. However, I'm rating it 4 stars vs 5 because unlike my old one, it doesn't have a built in timer where it stops automatically when the set cook time is complete. It's the same hassle as my gas oven. Yes it beeps, but unless you're right there to physically stop the cooking, the convection microwave oven continues cooking, risking over-cooking food. Yes I can set cooking times but it doesn't stop once the time runs out. It keeps cooking. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain

customer_reviews.title: Really poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Don’t purchase this microwave. I received it and used it twice. While making popcorn it basically overheated and broke. I called Cuisinart to get a replacement and was told they only fix microwaves and do not replace them. Even one that I used only 2 times! They also told me that I would have to pay to ship it to them! Really poor customer service. Amazon, however, refunded me. Don’t take the risk of purchasing a Cuisinart product. They do not stand behind their products!
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave
customer_reviews.text: So far this thing has done all that was promised. I wish it were just a little bigger, but other than that it’s great! I posted a picture of a large Pioneer Woman dinner plate inside of the microwave for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin King

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a year and bad warranty policy
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is a piece of junk. It broke within a year. When we called Cuisinart customer service, they said we had to pay to ship a heavy microwave to New Jersey where they would repair it. They were not able to give any estimate how long it would take to fix. Every microwave made by other companies that we have purchased has lasted 10-15 years. It is very disappointing that this Cuisinart microwave broke within a year. It is even more disappointing that their customer service is so poor. They should either have local repair options, pay for shipping or just provide refunds.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Poor product!! Great Amazon Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but, poor craftsman ship. Plunged the item in once on the Microwave setting for 3 minutes. Nothing in the unit just wanted to test the unit. It completed the 3 minutes, then there was a pop sound, an odor, the outlet was tripped and the unit stopped working. I contacted Amazon immediately and their customer services was excellent!!! They offered to resolve my issue in multiple ways! Within minutes I had a refund and I was back online shopping for a different unit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Baskerville

customer_reviews.title: The convection feature doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: We received the oven and were very excited to give it a try. I first tried a tray of frozen chicken nuggets, set the convection to 425 degrees and the timer to 15 minutes. After running for 15 minutes the temperature would not exceed 325 degrees so I ran it for another 10 minutes and it still didn't exceed 350 degrees, another 10 minutes and it achieved 375 degrees. I stopped and used my large oven instead... Amazon provided a credit for the item and didn't want me to return it so I certainly am not complaining about the customer service that I received. Now I have a nice microwave that doesn't work as a convection oven!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed latch
customer_reviews.text: We have had this item for just one year, purchased in January 2019...and the latch has broken. Poorly made latch...the microwave itself is functional...a shame that this component is so cheaply constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Pinou

customer_reviews.title: Our Cuisinart Microwave Broke Just After the first Year!
customer_reviews.text: The door handle broke on the microwave. Which has left it un-useable. I tried calling Cuisinart customer service several times and had no luck. Wrote an email and received a response saying we would be contacted, nobody called. I finally managed to talk to someone only to be told that we need to ship the microwave back and the repairs would take six weeks. In the meantime what do we do for a microwave? Very poor customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Lakehaven Cottage

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel easy to clean and no rattling when rotating
customer_reviews.text: Stainless steel is easy to clean. It is so quiet. It really makes a difference. The cheaper brands I got before only lasted an average of 3 years. The door opener always breaks, but the tray always rattled when it rotated. No rattling at all and handle opens differently. Time will tell how long it will last. The oldest microwave I owned lasted 15 years. They just don't make them like that anymore.
customer_reviews.author: imafan

customer_reviews.title: So far it's worked out great, only had to bake just a little longer ...
customer_reviews.text: I can microwave or bake with this! So far it's worked out great, only had to bake just a little longer than instructed if I want crispy foods like chicken nuggets. Only complaint is the back piece sticks out prevents from pushing back flat against the wall so it does take up a lot of counter space.
customer_reviews.author: TXCH

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am happy with it. However after only three months in use the door cracked. It is still under warranty, but for the price it would cost me to send it to Cuisinart, I can buy a new one. They also will not just send a replacement piece. I am stuck with if now, and will have to see how long it lasts with the cracked door.
customer_reviews.author: michelle reeb

customer_reviews.title: It was a great price and can do so much
customer_reviews.text: It was a great price and can do so much. Much more than my NUWAVE which I wish now I had not bought. It looks great too. I wish I had bought one a long time ago. It has a great cookbook too.
customer_reviews.author: shugaraii

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had a terrible experience with this product. After one month of use this microwave began making high pitch screeching noises while being used. I sent it into Cuisinart for repair. It has been several months since then and I still have not received the microwave, fixed or otherwise. My faith in Cuisinart products and their customer service has been lost and I will not be giving them any of my business in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Z

customer_reviews.title: Under powered
customer_reviews.text: 1st problem was the depth. It would not fit in the standard microwave slot we had so it became a countertop item occupying space we didn't have to spare. 2nd problem was lack of power in the convection mode. When set at the 400 degree mark it took over 25 minutes just to get the oven up to that temperature!!! Cooking time on the item was only 12 so the "speed" factor for convection cooking went out the window. As a microwave only it works okay and we honestly haven't tried grilling with the upper element yet. Were there a setting to have it and the convection element both on it might be more useful. Rather disappointed over all.
customer_reviews.author: Joe from Wichita Falls

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart CMW-200 1.2-Cubic-Foot Convection Microwave Oven Already Broken after Six Months
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that it was a convection and microwave oven, with plenty of room to cook what I needed. After two months, the latch to open the oven popped out. I was able to put the springs back in place and push it back into place. It happened two more times since I bought it in November. Today, in May of 2019, the latch totally stopped working. The door release connected to the latch dislodged inside behind the latch. Now, I have to take it to get fixed. Why are these ovens made not to last?
customer_reviews.author: Judy Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - Total junk broke after 1 year of moderate use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven after lengthy research for all the features I wanted. This one seemed to fit the bill, and then some. We have used the oven moderately over the last year since the purchase. The button you press to open the door feels cheap and is made of plastic, and would occasionally stick. I didn't think much of it until today when after microwaving something, the button is now permanently stuck and we can't open the door. For this product to be completely unusable in the span of a year is ridiculous. Don't waste your money, unless you think $200+ is a reasonable expectation for spending every year to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Karole

customer_reviews.title: Locked with food stuck in
customer_reviews.text: Saga of this product. Locked with cooked omelet inside. Product support could not assist and said they would pick it up. After 4 days in 95% temps in front of my house and no pick up we dragged to trash. It weighs 45lbs. And the smell was terrible. I would not do that to a UPS person or his truck. In 2 weeks a new one showed up. Pros: pretty, easy to clean, quiet Cons: very large requiring extended space, buttons hard to read, fear of locking with food
customer_reviews.author: lk

customer_reviews.title: This microwave/convection oven is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this microwave/convection oven hoping the combo was something that would work great because it certainly looks nice. It quit working within 6 weeks after light use. Now we have a nice looking Cuisinart microwave/convection oven that's only good for a door stop or a paperweight. Seriously, this thing is junk. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Research before you purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with my purchase until the door latch broke. I first tried to repair it locally but it turns out no one will touch them unless they are the mounted kind.. I then sent a note to amazon who sent me to the third party seller alphabet who referred me to cuisinart who per their warranty policy told me I need to box it up and return with proof of purchase and a 15.00 check and they will look at it. I am very unhappy with this outcome and will read the warranty before I purchase anything more and will never buy again from third party seller!
customer_reviews.author: eggiejh

customer_reviews.title: Excited to learn to cook in this thing!
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this combination unit although I have to read the directions every time I do something other than microwave. I chose this to be able to cook biscuits without having to have a separate toaster oven and a microwave. Yes I can use my big oven but it heats the kitchen up too much in the summer! So far the biscuits have not been too great but it may be the brand of biscuits. I am going to try a new brand and we shall see. It would be nice to have a better, more detailed cooking guide with it. Hopefully I will get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: geni

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful machine. So far I really like it
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful machine. So far I really like it. Have only tried the convection aspect of it once, but I intend to bake a cake in there soon, to see how it comes out. If a cake comes out nicely, then it would be a no-brainer that other food dishes would turn out good. This microwave/convection combo is a lovely addition to my counter top. I like the idea of being able to cook food in this small appliance as opposed to turning on the big oven to prepare small items, such as a few baked potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Walden

customer_reviews.title: Heating element stopped working after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: CMW-200. After reading all the warranty woes in the reviews I am not even going to bother with that. It is not worth the shipping expense and hassle. Plus I read that even the repaired products have problems. Cuisinart should offer an honest 1 year warranty, rather than a bogus 3 year warranty. And Amazon should stop mixing reviews for multiple models. That provides no incentive for Cuisinart to produce a new, improved model.
customer_reviews.author: Greenery

customer_reviews.title: Oven with an attitude
customer_reviews.text: This convection combo oven works well as a microwave. And, it does a pretty good job of roasting a chicken. However, it also annoys me. The signal for when the cycle is completed is five very loud beeps that are not able to be turned off and do not stop even if the door is opened. Also, upon shutting the door (even gently) the appliance occasionally sounds one beep, seems to reset itself, and all the preset times/temps/powers that I have programmed are deleted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got my micro back and more
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought, which fits my counter better. Marked heavy lift...and it really does require that consideration. Never convection cooked before so I will probably make some mistakes. Micro works great Inside would hold a roasting chicken, small pizza, 3 pound roast. Turn table works great. Preheat is not much shorter than for stove, but in the summer I will appreciate not heating the entire house. Heated surface as described I didn't have. Only on the side where the vent is.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Nydegger

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart may be best at this, but not at our home.
customer_reviews.text: As a microwave it is good. As a convection oven it is really slow to heat up and doesn't like anything frozen. Pizzas are a joke and doing muffins is hopeless. We are still learning what we can do with it, but we are finding more things we can't do with it. Good thing we bought this version instead of an over the stove model.
customer_reviews.author: RJUllman

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous  would give it zero stars
customer_reviews.text: Product is dangerous due to included rack has 3 legs will tip over. Too small for normal frozen pizza. Convection operation never gets to temperature always too low for cooking/baking. Plastic portions of outer door breaking and falling off. This product is a disgrace Cuisinart CMW-200 1.2-Cubic-Foot Convection Microwave Oven with Grill. Trash, trash, trash.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Completely unusable after just a few months
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked this this microwave. We bought it to replace a 20 year old Whirlpool unit. But then the door mechanism broke after just a few months, and the door will not open. Broken plastic parts have since fallen out of the unit as we tried and tried to open the door. The turntable and grill rack are stuck inside, an Cuisinart requires that we ship the unit back to them for service. We did not want to be without a microwave, so I bought another a different brand and returned this one through Amazon. Amazon was great! Cuisinart no so much. I guess I should've kept the 20 year old Whirlpool as it still worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: I expected better from a Cuisinart. The feel of the construction on this model is cheap and it is loud when operating. Also the clock on mine runs fast: every 4-5 days it's about a minute fast. How hard is it to get that right LOL. Other than that, it is OK. But there are better microwaves out there for the money (at least there use to be).
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Can not reccomend it
customer_reviews.text: Microwave works good but the convection oven does not work well at all! It took 45 minutes to get up to 425 degrees (which is the highest temperature it can go to) . It beeps when it gets up to temp (finally no lie after 45 minutes) then you open it up and put your food in and it just never gets back up to temp while cooking, total fail! Fine for 350 degree cooking but that's about it!!! Stay away! I should of listened to the reviews!!!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Y

customer_reviews.title: Not working right after few short months.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a few months. But now things don't get hot, even after being microwaved for 2-3 minutes. Don't know what is wrong. I have been very busy so I didn't even get a chance to try out the grill and oven features, just the regular microwaving. I thought it would be super to have these added features, and still think so, but not if the microwaving doesn't work right.
customer_reviews.author: Montana

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really make toast.
customer_reviews.text: We returned it after a couple weeks. I was looking for a toaster oven and microwave combo, but we tried several different things and it is just okay. I could not figure out how to make toast. The heating element/convection oven does make warm bread with a slightly dry surface, but it just isn't toasted bread like I want. Also, I think it would be difficult to get it to really make crispy things. It's a fine convection oven/microwave if that is what you seek.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Bad luck
customer_reviews.text: The microwave worked fine for the first 2 months but started to emit a high pitched sound when plugged in but not in use. My husband couldn't hear the high pitch but I could. Cuisinart would send a replacement but I had to pay to ship. I didn't have the original box either. Apparently this is not a common problem because the Cuisinart service center had never heard of it. I called a repair shop and he said it sounded like the board had failed and that a repair could cost $300 or more. Looks like others have had better luck but I won't buy another expensive microwave after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Schmendy

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave
customer_reviews.text: Great microwave for the price. Runs very quiet compared to most. It looks great and I have gotten a ton of compliments on it already. The only thing I don't like is the beeping when it is done is extremely loud and opening the door doesn't stop the beeping. The only other thing is the lowest amount of time you can set it for is 30 seconds which is a bit odd. Other than that its a great microwave for the price point
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Dual Functionality is great
customer_reviews.text: We did some renovations to the kitchen and replaced our over the stove microwave with a hood. We needs a smaller microwave that would fit in our pantry. This Cuisinart fit the bill. The dual functionality of the convection oven and microwave was a key selling point. It does the job and looks pretty sharp as well. We have only had it less than a month so I can't speak on durability but Cuisinart is a solid company.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A Plante

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy I bought this microwave for my sister for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I bought this microwave for my sister for Christmas. It's beautiful, is BPA FREE, and is very attractive in her kitchen. It's a very well made Cuisinart, heats very well, easy to use, and aside from it being a bit pricey, she is worth it, and the microwave does not disappoint. Highly recommend this unit. It's just gorgeous..
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: Door release malfunction issue, it slides all over the counter!
customer_reviews.text: The microwave door release button malfunctioned, this is not worth the money I invested, this was a gift for my Daughters housewarming, she complained about the fact the door was an issue, also each time she pressed on it, the microwave would slide easily, waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: CANDY

customer_reviews.title: This item is not returnable - Please be aware
customer_reviews.text: Please note - this item is NOT returnable. It arrived with a small dent in it and Amazon would not return it. After much complaining, Cuisinart sent me a second one free of charge, but again, the first was not returnable as of February 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Moisturizer Addict

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere... "NOT DEPENDABLE"....
customer_reviews.text: This has been my third Cuisinart CMW-200...since 2018... & Today my third purchase of this microwave has broken/stopped working... Today's date is July 2020... I have to say that I loved the "features" of this microwave since it had the combo features... BUT.... The "dependability" of it lasting for any length of time... has been a "total" disappoinment... Today the third purchase of this microwave has broken... twice I have had the door opening device break...not being able to get what was inside the microwave out... & Once my grill option quit working... Customer service has been very disappointing... So Today... I will look for other buying options... Hopefully finding a "dependable"...microwave...
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.. Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought one years ago.. After 2 years still works great.. It is used everyday.. Now it does take some ready to figure out how to use every function.. I even use it to cook homemade butter milk bisquits
customer_reviews.author: jason calvert

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: This thing is ok. It takes awhile to heat up on convection. The standard 110volt power source is the limitation. It is good for the occasional oven user, but I would use a toaster oven or even pizza oven if you were needing a more frequent heat source. I still use my outdoor BBQ gas grill for most baking. I have no other interior oven. The microwave works well and is nice and quiet. I probably would not buy it again. Be sure you have enough room behind the oven, as it requires about 6" of clearance for the rear wall and the sides need space too. It would be good on a cart.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Heal

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE APPLIANCE...until....
customer_reviews.text: I loved this microwave. Used it for everything. Convection, toaster, microwave... it did it all. Must have used this at least 10 times a day. My 7 year old son even used it. Seriously a workhorse until the door mechanism broke. I've spent the past week trying to find someone who will fix the door. No one works on small appliances anymore I guess. So annoying! Anyway, I loved it until it brokje. ;( ;( ;(
customer_reviews.author: H. Jamieson

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a few months, the door latch breaks.
customer_reviews.text: Three years and two days after I bought it, the door latch broke. No parts are available. I would never buy an appliance I cannot repair. User manual says parts are available.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: You have to pay for huge $$ shipping to use the warranty if it breaks, so forget it
customer_reviews.text: Still under warranty, Yay!!! What, 38 pounds ship from CA to AZ at $47. one way??? If I had bought it at Costco I could take it back today and get a new one. The handle broke and it won't open, some trim broke off around the opening also. It is a great machine and functions beautifully but this bogus warranty deal is unacceptable. Can get it fixed locally but Cuisinart won't reimburse. So I should spend my time and nearly $100 to ship it and wait weeks for return?? Not Cool
customer_reviews.author: glo

customer_reviews.title: I would rate this 5 stars, however because it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this 5 stars, however because it's not very heavy, it slides back when pushing the door release button, when trying to hold the side when opening the door - it slides. I ended up putting some rubber feet under it and it solved the sliding problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: ... was refurbished but lasted 4 or 5years this works great love the stainless Steel inside eliminates smells and cleans ...
customer_reviews.text: couldn't wait for it to arrive this makes my 2nd Cuisinart the 1st one was refurbished but lasted 4 or 5years this works great love the stainless Steel inside eliminates smells and cleans well love Cuisinart
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: what 's going on with amazon !
customer_reviews.text: This appliance only works as a microwave but not for any of the other fonctions it is advertised for , such as grill or convection oven . I have been a very satisfied amazon prime member for many years but not so much these past few months as there has been issues with most of my latest orders .Very disappointed indeed ...will think twice now before ordering from amazon again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price and functionality
customer_reviews.text: very happy with this unit so far. Baking isn't perfect but much better than standard microwave. It seems a little complicated sometimes; cooking micro convection; micro solo; or microwave high convection. I am also worried about what dishes to use based on the type of cooking. Once I get used to it; I think it will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Mazzeo

customer_reviews.title: Worst Microwave Convection Oven EVER!  Zero Customer Service. 3 Year Warranty is a SHAM!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a year and a half then would not turn on. Contact Cuisinart who gives you the run around and a promise of an RMA coming in your EMAIL. No email ever received. If I could rate this a -5 i would do so. This is a piece of junk and no customer warranty support whatsoever. They tell you it will be SIX weeks turnaround for repair but they want you to ship it to them and return shipping at YOUR EXPENSE. Cuisinart used to be a great company. This is my last purchase Ever from Cuisinart. DO NOT BUY THIS FLIMSY CHINESE Piece of Junk!
customer_reviews.author: WR

customer_reviews.title: Turntable cracked in half after only 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I love this oven. The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is after just 2 months of use, the turntable split in half. Disappointing as in the instructions it very clearly states “Do not use without turntable in place”. I’ve no idea how to order a replacement turntable and can no longer use my oven. I could understand if I did something to damage the turntable, but I didn’t. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: I don't remember how long ago I purchased this but I wanted to write a review. This is an amazing product!! Like all Cuisinart products this is superlative. Plus, the versatility allowed me to get rid less versatile appliances.
customer_reviews.author: judycan

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace an older unit in our summer place. It works well. Like most microwave ovens if you clean it quickly after each use it is easy to keep clean. If you use it a few times consecutively without cleaning well, expect to have a workout removing baked on liquid drops. Using plastic microwave dish covers can save a lot of time for a very modest investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our trip from Lake Erie to Florida on our boat. We really enjoy having this on our boat. We no longer needed a separate microwave and oven. Now we will move this from our boat we took down south to our new used boat. We have an inverter on our boat and found we can use the microwave convection oven with the inverter also. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L Clark

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Sadley disappointed becauseI thought Cuisinart was a higher end product. Blows fuses. Doesn't cook evenly and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microwave on March 31, 2018 and it has almost lasted 2 years. A couple days ago the door would not open, we tried every thing to get it to open but it won't. After reading other reviews about the crappy warranty and customer service I am not even going to try to send it to get fixed with my own money. What kind of warranty makes you pay for shipping, repairing and sending it back? Not buying any more of their overpriced products!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie L

customer_reviews.title: A not-so-useful microwave
customer_reviews.text: The microwave is big, takes up lots of space. It gets pretty hot if you use the oven setting. It stopped working after two years of use. Do yourself a favor and purchase from costco.
customer_reviews.author: Arin B.

customer_reviews.title: Durability we'll have to see over time but I'm hopeful.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Sharp Grill 2 Covection I've had for 10yrs. It is more powerful but the grilling aspect doesn't quite measure up to the Sharp performance. Unfortunately they don't produce that anymore. Having a device that can Grill, Microwave and do Convection cooking is an invaluable kitchen tool. I have high hopes for the life and performance of this one. So far, I'm impressed even with the lessor grilling ability.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This unit stopped working with in a year and cuisinart refused to simply replace it. They wanted me to send it to them for repair, which would take approximately 4-6 weeks. Terrible policy! How can anyone honestly go without a microwave for that long? With 2 toddlers at home, that is simply not an option for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rust Marks on the back wall
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't been a month yet and the back panel has already rust marks. It worked great while it lasted. I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Volkan

customer_reviews.title: I’m thinking of returning it.
customer_reviews.text: I normally love Cuisinart products, but this one seems cheap. It’s small and lightweight, and moves when I open and close the door. The controls are not like I want to use. I’d rather push power button and one number and have to push the power button five times to get it down to the fifth power. I’m thinking of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hill

customer_reviews.title: The convection mode is easy. Especially the preprogrammed settings
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm really liking this. The convection mode is easy. Especially the preprogrammed settings. Loved being able to roast a chicken without heating up the whole kitchen! Will try baking in it next. The one not so great problem referred to by other reviewers is the button you push to open the door. Doesn't totally release the door without a gentle pull on the door while you are pushing the button- clearly not a well designed or sturdy feeling mechanism. Other than that this is a very nice and well priced appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou Gross

customer_reviews.title: Controls are confusing
customer_reviews.text: There probably isn't a better microwave available, but purchasers should be aware that the door opens to the left rather than the right and most annoying the preset times require you to hit the start button repeatedly to increment for 30 sec intervals. Simply inputting your time is not an option. The kitchen timer on the control panel has absolutely no function with the microwave. In addition, the unit is flimsy. On the plus side, it's a very convenient size with a large capacity interior space and a small footprint. The maximum setting is as powerful as the commercial units while using a lower energy load.
customer_reviews.author: Antiqco

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stainless steel outside Very Cheap guts inside.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this microwave since Dec 2018. The door mechanism broke and the screws to take it apart are very small and not even a star tip. My soup is held hostage and it will go on the junk pile. I thought the better brand would be of quality but I was wrong. I am not putting more money out on this. I can buy a cheaper item and be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A Belanger

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for toasting.  Takes too long to toast
customer_reviews.text: The convection oven part takes too long to heat up. Takes about 10 minutes just to toast something.
customer_reviews.author: ING130

customer_reviews.title: Door issues are real
customer_reviews.text: We liked the look and features of this microwave and were looking forward of years of use. However, the door would not open after the first use. Thinking perhaps it was a safety feature, we scoured the instruction manual to troubleshoot it. We then took a closer look at the Amazon reviews and learned this model microwave has a problem with the door mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: IndigoGirl

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last☹️
customer_reviews.text: This microwave has a 3 year warranty and it stopped working about 2 weeks after the date of purchase, I haven’t heard from Cuisinart,
customer_reviews.author: ks

customer_reviews.title: Door broke after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The microwave worked fine, but after 2 years I was unable to open the door. Turns out there was a plastic part in the back of the front touch pad panel that snapped off making it impossible to open the door. There is a 3 yr warranty on the microwave, but Cuisinart will not send the part needed and you have to send the entire microwave to Arizona to be repaired. This is a major inconvenience along with the $15 to ship it. The part couldn't cost that much. I may have to get it repaired since I paid over $200 for the microwave, but I would not buy Cuisinart again.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Keep Looking, this is not the oven you want!
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a nice looking oven, it is big, super hot and difficult to clean. The learning curve is long in figuring out how exactly to use it, instructions could be a lot clearer. I struggled along with it for about a year then decided to go back to the Breville Smart Oven, which we had lost in a move. It's the best counter top oven out there and cooks fast enough I don't even need a microwave feature.
customer_reviews.author: Livesaboard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent microwave!
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with this microwave with one exception. The labels on the function buttons are hard to read! The letters are white on a grey background which make them difficult to see! We love the stainless steel housing and interior!
customer_reviews.author: jminyard

customer_reviews.title: We had previously had a Sharp convection- microwave oven and loved it, so when it needed replaced we wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year and kept it although it has never functioned well as a convection oven, so we have just continued using it as a microwave, We had previously had a Sharp convection- microwave oven and loved it, so when it needed replaced we wanted another convection-microwave. We chose this one because of the brand name and it was within our budget. Unfortunately, the whole family has been disappointed in its performance; taking twice as long to bake something and it might still not be done. We won't buy another from Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: ALgirl

customer_reviews.title: AAAAAA+++++++++ BEST OF THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY EAST TO USE AND CLEAN! Booklet that comes with it is super easy to read and understand. Wish we would have purchased this years ago! Will NEVER go back to "just" a microwave plus it is a Cuisinart which makes truly amazing products and will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: One day, after less than six months of use, The door of the microwave just wouldn’t open. We called and called and finally reach somebody at Cuisinart who said they would honor their warranty. They sent us a UPS mailing label to send it back to them. That was like six months ago. We have not heard a thing back from Cuisinart. No money no contact no nothing. The convection aspect of the microwave was very difficult to use and not very efficient at all. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis D Gartenberg

customer_reviews.title: MICROWAVE IS DEFECTIVE; QUIT WORKING AFTER 4 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: THIS MICROWAVE STOPPED WORKING FOUR MONTHS AFTER DELIVERY. AMAZON WILL NOT TAKE IT BACK AND CUISINART TELLS ME THAT IT WILL TAKE FOUR TO SIX WEEKS TO REPAIR OR REPLACE THE MICROWAVE. AMAZON DELIVERED THE MICROWAVE IN ONE DAY AND NOW I HAVE TO WAIT FOUR TO SIX WEEKS TO GET THIS MADE RIGHT. AMAZON HAS DROPPED THE BALL. CUISINART IS NO HELP. WHAT A ROTTEN DEAL. A ROTTEN DEAL.
customer_reviews.author: J Horwitz

customer_reviews.title: Piece of JUNK !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used 4 times and it crashed and burned called to get is fixed you have to pay to ship it to them($70) and pay for them to ship it back to you. What a joke will NEVER buy another one of their products, piece of JUNK.......
customer_reviews.author: Chris Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Light bulb broke within 3 weeks of owning and still ...
customer_reviews.text: Light bulb broke within 3 weeks of owning and still haven’t gotten any response on how to remedy it. Purchased the appliance protection plan, and no one has answered any of my emails 😞
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: Like it, but; a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Popcorn button doesn't really work well. We had to just cook the popcorn and time it ourselves to figure out the best time to get the most popped and not burn it. Haven't attempted the oven feature yet.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pottertacke

customer_reviews.title: Fine microwave, lousy toaster
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this maybe 2 years ago. I initially wanted this to replace our toaster oven, and consolidate toone appliance. Well that didn't happen because it takes 5 minutes to toast one side of the bread. While it can "toast" and bake a little, the cooking time is really long, and the instructions on how to use it are confusing. Cook with 50%microwave and 50% convection, or 70/30? I don't know! Long story short it's a fine microwave, but a lousy toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Elder

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Convection cooking all the time these days!! Don't let the bad reviews sway you. I am 100% sure that none of them can follow directions, causing their heating/noise/longevity issues. Have had it for 2 years and it still works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cox

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 years then just stopped
customer_reviews.text: We used it everyday with no problems. After 2 years, it just stopped working. Trying to return since it's within the 3 yr warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi C.

customer_reviews.title: CHILDPROOF DOOR DOESN'T OPEN. READ ALL REVIEWS BEFORE YOU BUY.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find a over that was microwave, convection and grill. Thought I was smart buying Cuisinart. I should have read the reviews before I purchased. Used the Microwave once and it was fine. Used the oven and couldn't open the door. Followed all instruction still couldn't open and there was food inside. Cuisinart was not helpful. Amazon customer service Heidi in Kentucky was wonderful. I will not buy Cuisinart again. Amazon is lucky to have such a professional service rep. like Heidi. Kathleen
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M.

customer_reviews.title: Almost burnt house down. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Glass seal was broken from the beginning... now overheated and almost burnt our house down from overheating. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Carrie lewis

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but does not cook correctly at the settings
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but does not cook correctly at the settings. For example, at 375 degrees convection for a 2.3 lb ham, it should cook for under 45 minutes. It takes about 55 minutes and the meat is very dry. The "express" buttons do not function well at all. A small potato is not completely baked using the potato button, half of a bag of popcorn does not pop using the popcorn button. Have not tried the grill function yet but think I will only be using this oven microwaving, setting the times manually.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: not sure about this product
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised at the lack of quality of this product. It makes a terrible noise when in use. The convection feature does not cook food very well and gets extremely hot during use. It's basically a noisy microwave. I waited too long and now can't return it. The only option is a repair. Not convinced it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah R. Herbst

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY A MICROWAVE FROM AMAZON!
customer_reviews.text: After I received the microwave and it was loud and emitted a lot of light from the back of the unit I sent to Conair for repair. This is the explanation from Conair when I asked what was wrong with the microwave that it had to be replaced: "Thank you for your response. The warehouse deemed it unrepairable and they do not tell us what is wrong with it under warranty we repair if unrepeatable we replace it no further information available. We apologize for any inconvenience." This is a microwave ladies and gentlemen!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Taylor

customer_reviews.title: AAA great buy, amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I'm in LOVE!!!! I am a professional chef in Las Vegas and I bought this to replace my microwave, my standard oven, my convection oven. I can bake broil what ever I please it works amazing
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: The versatility of baking and microwaving in one mid-sized unit.
customer_reviews.text: Microwave and bake; or do a combination of both for things like quick baked potatoes. This is a medium-sized unit and is great for warming portions for a small family. We use it daily, and like that it does not take up much counter space.
customer_reviews.author: WY

customer_reviews.title: Failed within 6mo
customer_reviews.text: Great microwave until 6mo in, when the magnetron started making a 90+db vibration noise whenever the microwave turns on. Now it cannot be used. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Extra steps required to switch from Microwave to Convection.
customer_reviews.text: Microwave works great, relatively easy to clean and over all quite good as a Microwave. The convection oven is where it looses a star because before you can even use it as such you have to either remove the spinning glass plate or flip it upside down... both are a step that I feel should not be required. Also the baking rack thing it comes with is total trash.
customer_reviews.author: Linksys120n

customer_reviews.title: same size and it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Received a defective microwave. The company it came from Houseware Harmony won't let me return it because it's past the 30 days. The microwave trips every breaker, no matter where I plug it in and they are dedicated 20 Amp breakers. Got a different brand microwave, same size and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gingrich

customer_reviews.title: Convection
customer_reviews.text: We love it. Had a different brand for years but nothing lasts for ever. It works as well as the other one. Have backed cake on convection setting several times so far and comes out perfect and heating up the kitchen! Bundt pan fits perfect
customer_reviews.author: J.Ph

customer_reviews.title: The button that is used to open the microwave door ...
customer_reviews.text: The button that is used to open the microwave door broke after only two uses. Called Cuisinart and they wanted to charge for shipping both ways. Thankfully Amazon is taking care of my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 2 years - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for two years then the button to open it failed so it cannot be opened. Big name but very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worse Cuisinart product
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worse product from this company I have ever purchased. I also purchased a Cuisinart toaster oven for my camper that was similarly awful. What a shame, the best convection toaster oven I ever owned back in the 1980's was the best and I thought I would get similar results with these two purchases, sadly mistaken. The convection microwave is useless for anything more than microwaving. The inside does not clean well either.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mosley

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I’ve really only used my new Cuisinart Convection Microwave Oven and Grill for a few of its simplest features (like microwaving & defrosting) but it’s very easy to use with its bold touch pad and “go-to” buttons. Food is thoroughly cooked/not rubbery or “hot spots”. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Meowza

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CMW-200 1.2-Cubic-Foot Convection Microwave Oven with Grill
product_meta.description: Size:1.2-Cubic-FootDELIVERY ALERT: This item ships in its original packaging and may be visible upon delivery! Cuisinart CMW-200 1-1/5 Cubic Foot Convection Microwave Oven W/ Grill 1000-watt countertop convection microwave oven and grill1-1/5 cubic-foot interior; 12-inch rotating glass tray for even heating Touchpad control panel; 9 preset options, plus grill function; multi-stage cooking Defrost by weight or time; reversible grill rack; instructions/recipes included Measures 23-2/3 by 21 by 14-3/5 inches; 3-year limited .

Brushed stainless with embossed Cuisinart logo and dark tinted glass window
Stainless steel interior absorbs no odors and is easy to sanitize, Rotating 12-Inch glass tray, Reversible grill rack.MC Cubic Feet: 4.95
Touchpad controls with LCD, Two convenient defrost functions to defrost food by weight or time, Convection bake or roast with and without microwave function
Instruction and recipe book included, BPA Free

1.2 cubic-foot interior; 12-inch rotating glass tray for even heating, External Dimensions: 20.4" x 18.9" x 12.4".
Touchpad control panel; 9 preset options, plus grill function
